title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: news , sport , travel and weather updates on friday 23 september 2016 .
paralympian robinson returns to the pool .
police and crime commissioners meet to discuss working together .
businesses in the county say they 're suffering from poor internet connections .
people in northants urged to walk 'twenty million steps ' this weekend .

text: northampton town and the missing money

text: northampton saints 15-20 wasps

documents.title: our live updates across the day
text: that 's it for our regular updates of news , travel , weather and sport from all the team here at local live for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday .
enjoy what looks like a mostly dry weekend ahead !
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: overnight and saturday weather : dry and clear , with spells of sunshine
text: it will stay dry tonight with long clear spells , but high cloud will increase from the west through the early hours .
not as chilly as last night , with temperatures falling to 8c ( 46f ) in a light southerly breeze .
it should be dry on saturday with spells of hazy sunshine , although large amounts of high cloud at times .
feeling warm with temperatures reaching highs of 24c ( 75f ) , but with a noticeably gusty southerly wind .
get the full forecast where you live at bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: tresham principal steps down
text: the principal of tresham college , which has campuses in corby , kettering and wellingborough , has decided to step down from the role at the end of the month .
first mentioned in the northamptonshire telegraph , stuart wesselby has been in the role for almost five years .
last month the college received an ofsted rating of `` inadequate '' , though the reason why mr wesselby is leaving has not been made public .

in a statement , simon evans , chair of governors , said : `` i would like to thank stuart for the contribution he has made to the development of the college and its students during his time as principal , most recently by securing funding for the wellingborough campus development . ''
the college says corrie harris , vice principal for curriculum and quality , will take over until a permanent successor is announced .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: this weekend 's sport news
text: northampton saints have ben foden back for tomorrow 's visit of wasps to franklin 's gardens .
harry mallinder gets his chance in the team after luther burrell 's injury last week and nic groom starts at scrum-half .
in the pack there 's still no dylan hartley .
sam dickinson takes over from michael paterson at lock and jamie gibson starts at flanker in place of teimana harrison .
in football , northampton town are at home to southend .
the non-league action sees salford city playing brackley in the national league north and in the southern premier league kettering take on dunstable .
corby are at home to coalville town in the northern premier league .
find all the latest sports news at bbc sport .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: corby hos reveals garden improvements
text: the gardens at a corby hos have had a makeover thanks to the generosity of local businesses .
lakelands hos end-of-life care and this week revealed improvements to its gardens , including a redecorated summer house with a new electric ramp .
a team from plastics company amaray helped with work at the hos which needs to raise £ 500,000 yearly for running costs .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: batsman duckett to stay at steelbacks
text: northants cricketer ben duckett has signed an extension to his contract which will see him remain at the club until the end of 2018 .
the batsman has had a hugely successful season at the steelbacks as well as an england call-up .
he will soon be departing for bangladesh as part of both the test and one day international squads .
i intend to make the most of playing for my country which is a dream come true , but i 'm looking forward to coming back to wantage road and building on northamptonshire 's success . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: collaboration meeting between two police chiefs , but no talk of merger
text: the police and crime commissioners for northamptonshire and cambridgeshire have met today to talk about how the forces can work better together .
the commissioners ' stress that while there 's room to work more closely , there 's no suggestion of a merger .
northamptonshire commissioner stephen mold ( of the need to `` share intelligence '' and `` talk to one another '' .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: duckett signs new northants contract
text: duckett signs new northants contract

documents.title: 'show them it does n't go unnoticed ' # bbcunsunghero
text: find out how you can nominate your unsung hero here .

documents.title: in the papers this lunchtime
text: the northants telegraph reports an education trust has expressed its disappointment after one of its northamptonshire schools was rated inadequate by ofsted .
meanwhile , the northampton chronicle and echo also features the homecoming of paralympic swimming champion ellie robinson , who says the town `` needs a 50m swimming pool '' .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paralympic hero robinson returns to the pool
text: northampton gold medallist ellie robinson received a hero 's welcome as she returned to the pool following her success at rio 2016 .
wearing that coat , she showed off her two paralympic medals to team-mates at northampton swimming club , including the gold she won in the s6 50m butterfly .
author: Jonathan Park
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: plenty of sunshine across the county
text: we 're expecting plenty of sunny weather across the county today before the cloud increases later this afternoon .
thank you to weather watcher `` mcfreddie '' for this scene of spratton this morning .
post your at bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: advance traffic warning for northampton sports fixtures
text: the roads around sixfields stadium and franklin 's gardens in northampton are expected to be busy tomorrow as both the cobblers and saints have home games starting at 15:00 .
northampton saints host coventry-based wasps , and after the excitement of taking on manchester united , northampton town now prepare to take on southend .

documents.title: businesses 'hampered by poor internet '
text: businesses in the county say they 're frustrated by poor internet connections .
some companies in northampton have told the bbc they 've even resorted to using their home connections , are they 're faster than what 's available .
mark heath is the managing director of office equipment company blue fish , based on the brackmills industrial estate .
he says it 's a `` real battle '' and `` slows his staff down '' .
a new project called gigabit northampton is promising broadband speeds 100 times faster than average .
the county council has welcomed the initiative as another step towards what it calls `` superfast northamptonshire '' .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: willey in championship bid at lords
text: local boy david willey is gearing up for an enthralling last day of the cricket season at lords with his new team yorkshire .
the northern side are hoping to beat middlesex to win the county championship for the third time running .
whoever wins will be crowned champions , but a draw will see somerset pip them both to the post .
you can get full coverage at bbc sport .
final day of the season @ twitterid unbelievable days play ahead !
this is why we play

gwarn dave rip into em lad
think you might be opening batsman for us today !
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weekend walking challenge begins
text: people are being encouraged to take out their pedometers for the county council 's twenty millions steps weekend .
the challenge looks to promote the health and well-being effects of walking .
last year people across the county smashed the 20m target walking 34m steps , so this time around the target is 40m .
the # 20mstepsx2 challenge starts today - go for a walk fri , sat or sun and log your steps at
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : chilly start
text: it 's a bit of a chilly start this morning , but the day is due to turn dry and sunny , although it is set to be cloudier later this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .

BBC Look East weather

text: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live for friday , 23 september .
stay with us as we bring you regular live updates of the latest news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news by email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: regular updates for northamptonshire

any breaking news will appear here overnight .

have a good evening .

BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'racial assault ' in northampton
text: police say they 're investigating an attack on a 60-year-old man which appears to have been racially motivated .
it happened on the afternoon of wednesday 14 september in hunter street on the mounts..
the victim was pushed and verbally abused by three teenagers , who are described as black and between 14 and 16 years old .
all were wearing black and yellow school blazers .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: overnight weather : mostly dry and quite chilly
text: isolated showers across the east this evening will soon fade away , leaving a mostly dry night with lengthy clear spells .
it 'll become quite chilly , with a few mist patches , as temperatures fall to 6c ( 43f ) in rural areas .
friday will be largely dry , with sunny spells at first , although cloud will bubble-up during the day .
feeling pleasantly warm , with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
get the full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: water company 's £ 15m battle against 'flushable ' wipes
text: householders in the east of england flush away around 800 tonnes of `` flushable '' wipes and sanitary items every week .
that 's according to anglian water .
the utility company is calling for an end to misleading claims on product packaging , saying the wipes do n't break down like conventional toilet paper after going down the loo .
this week , a declaration has been signed by the uk and nine other countries outlining the water industry 's position on products labelled `` flushable '' .
so who pops the most wipes down the pan , in this region ?
northampton tops the tables , with 40 tonnes a week .
this is how other cities and towns compare :
clearing the blockages costs anglian water £ 15m a year..
this cost , says spokeswoman rachel dyson , is ultimately added on to customers ' water bills - and would be better spent elsewhere .
only the 3 'p 's should be flushed - pee , poo and ( toilet ) paper . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp says more cash will reduce cancelled operations
text: the conservative mp for kettering , philip hollobone , says the nhs needs extra money to help hospitals cut the number of operations that get cancelled at the last minute .
research suggests government statistics are not reflecting the true extent of the problem , because they only include surgery cancelled on the day it was scheduled .
in northamptonshire , just under 2,000 operations were shelved in the three days before they were due to happen last year , but the government has only recorded the 908 cancelled on the day .
mr hollobone said : `` the nhs has asked the government to provide £ 10bn a year by 2020 , and that is what the government is committed to doing . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: daventry company makes bid for berry
text: a company in daventry has got in early with its suggestion for a new career for tv cookery star mary berry .
ms berry has announced that she wo n't be appearing on the great british bake-off when it transfers to channel 4 .
alltube engineering has taken to social media to suggest an alternative for her

documents.title: police warning after bank card theft
text: police are urging people to be vigilant after a northampton woman was tricked into handing over her bank card .
she received a call from a man who said he was from virgin media and there was a problem with the woman 's bill .
he added that someone from the bank would be visiting her to collect her bank card .
a man subsequently called at the house and was given the card .
the woman became sus and contacted her bank .
no money was stolen but the police say fraudsters can be very convincing .
pc callum hurst said : `` the bank will never ask for your pin or call at your house to collect bank cards . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : dry evening with occasional showers
text: today has been a relatively warm day in northamptonshire , offering ideal opportunities for exploring lesser-known spots in the county - like the memorial square in northampton .
tonight 's expected to be dry , with one or two showers passing through in the early hours .
temperatures will fall to 9c ( 48f ) and tomorrow will see a fine but chilly start .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: simmonds wants your unsung hero nominations # bbcunsunghero
text: find out how you can nominate your unsung hero here .

documents.title: revell goal against man utd 'a moment to remember '
text: alex revell has been reliving the moment he scored a penalty against manchester united .
the goal left the score at 1-1 as the teams went into half-time during last night 's game .
the visitors put the game beyond the hosts ' reach with two goals in the second half , but , for a few golden minutes , a famous giant-killing victory looked possible .
`` it meant a great deal because all my family were there , '' said revell .
`` there are a few moments in football you have to remember because , when you finish , you can look back and say that was one of the best moments of my career .
`` it was great to score and get us back into the game . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: in the papers : travellers told to leave northampton park
text: the northants herald and post reports that a group of travellers who are camping on northampton 's racecourse will be served with a court order , after failing to leave .
herald & post
northamptonuk
travellers to be served with court order after failing to leave ift.tt/2cvwtgv
travellers to be served with court order after failing to leave

documents.title: boat engines stolen from sea cadets
text: motorboat engines worth about £ 14,000 have been stolen from the sea cadets ' boathouse in thrapston .
it means hundreds of cadets coming to the county from all over the uk have had their training courses cancelled , and many of them wo n't now be able to take national vocational qualifications .
neil hartwell , the centre manager at the thrapston boat station , is urging anyone with information to contact the police .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton not disgraced - revell
text: northampton not disgraced - revell

documents.title: this afternoon 's headlines
text: if you 're just joining us , here are some of the stories we 're looking at :
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: residents foil school break-in
text: northamptonshire police says a man who was trying to break into a primary school ran off , because local residents shouted at him .
it happened on tuesday evening at green oaks primary academy in kingsthorpe .
the man tried to smash a window in the reception office before he was spotted by people living nearby .
anyone with information is being asked to contact the police or crimestoppers .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: reporter describes impact of cancelled operation
text: today we 're reporting that government figures for cancelled operations only include those that are scheduled on the day they were due to take place .
the number called off up to three days before the planned date is significantly higher .
i had an operation on my right foot last year and my left foot this year .
both were cancelled - last year , it happened on the day itself .
this year , i was scheduled for an operation which was cancelled twice a couple of days beforehand .
after the last postponement , i inquired how many operations are being shelved , and discovered that the department of health only requires `` on the day '' statistics .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: in the papers : man utd stars at sixfields and a bid to save a derelict ground
text: the northampton chronicle and echo reflects on a memorable night at sixfields , which saw stars like zlatan ibrahimovic and even bobby charlton walk into the cobblers ' stadium .
the paper says the game , which ended 3-1 in the visitors ' favour , was no giant killing but the hosts `` did themselves proud '' .
the evening telegraph reports on a stadium where the glory days appear to be well and truly over .
there 's been a second bid to register the disused kettering town ground at rockingham road as a community asset .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: hundreds of cancelled operations 'not counted ' in official figures
text: research suggests hundreds of cancelled operations are not being recorded in official statistics because they were n't shelved on the scheduled date .

the nhs recorded that 908 procedures were cancelled last year in northamptonshire , but that figure only reflects those cases in which patients were told on the day the surgery was due to take place .
just over 2,000 were cancelled in the three days leading up to the scheduled date , or on the day itself .
deborah needham , from northampton general hospital , says operations are only cancelled as a last resort , but sometimes it ca n't be avoided .
`` it might be because we 've got staff sickness , or we need a specialist piece of equipment , or it might be consecutive days of intense emergency pressure , '' she said .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: chance to have a say on controversial daventry canal plan
text: a planning consultation 's been launched on revised proposals for a canal extension into daventry .
the project 's been on the cards for several years but there have been some changes , including redesigned bridges and new ground levels .
the proposal was first suggested in 2004 , but the only physical sign of a canal twelve years on is a bridge created for the waterway to flow under .
local people have 21 days to comment on the 1.6 mile ( 2.6km ) canal extension

documents.title: woman , 71 , in 224-mile cuba cycle ride
text: a 71-year-old woman is setting herself the challenge of cycling 224 miles ( 362km ) in five days in the caribbean .
catherine hancox , from collyweston , is raising money for the women 's health charity , the genesis research trust .
she says older people should get up and do something .
`` for heaven 's sake , do n't just sit down and accept the fact that you 're a senior citizen now and you should n't be doing this or doing that , '' she said .
nothing 's going to break or fall off .
you just go out there and do it . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: welcome to autumn !
text: get your wellies at the ready as today officially marks the start of autumn !
the name equinox means `` equal night '' in latin .
it 's the day of the year when all points on the earth 's surface experience the same lengths of daylight and darkness - 12 hours of each .
the autumn equinox in the northern hemisphere always falls on 22 , 23 or 24 september .
do you recognise any of our beautiful scenes in northamptonshire ?
they are ( left to right ) harlestone firs , chapel brampton , blisworth and raunds .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northants batsman shortlisted for national award
text: northants batsman ben duckett has been nominated by fellow professional cricketers for the natwest player of the year award .
the 21-year-old is also on the shortlist for the young player of the year category .
he scored a massive 2,706 runs in 2016 and hit a record-breaking 220 not out against sri lanka a whilst playing for their english lions .
the winners will be announced at the grosvenor house hotel in london next wednesday .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: the goal : alex revell is cobblers hero after goal against manchester united
text: northampton town striker alex revell is basking in glory this morning after scoring past manchester goalkeeper sergio romero in the 42nd minute of last night 's game .
here 's the moment he converted his penalty .

documents.title: cobblers fans praise team 's effort against manchester united
text: there 's praise this morning for the northampton town team that forced manchester united to bring on zlatan ibrahimovic and marcus rashford to guarantee victory .
the cobblers held united until the 67th minute but eventually went down 3-1 .
james averill , from the northampton town supporters trust , said : `` what a great effort from the players to go toe to toe with such a quality team . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

it should be dry for the majority of the day , but there is a risk of the odd spot of rain .

today we 'll be finding out why official figures hide the true impact of cancelled operations in northamptonshire , and get reaction to northampton town 's encounter with the mighty manchester united .

thanks for joining us .

BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: remember cobblers v man u in 1970 ?
text: northampton town 's third round efl cup tie tonight against manchester united evokes memories of a famous match between the two sides in 1970 .
united won their fa cup clash 8-2 , with george best scoring six of them .
the two sides have never played each other in the league cup , but had another meeting in 2004 in the fa cup which the red devils won 3-0 .
former cobblers full-back ray fairfax has been reflecting on what it was like to try and mark george best when the two sides met in 1970

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight but sunny spells first thing tomorrow
text: there will be variable amounts of cloud overnight , with a few showers and isolated fog patches .
temperatures falling to around 13c ( 55f ) .
tomorrow will start off with sunny spells and a few showers .
thicker cloud and patchy rain will then spread eastwards , with brighter conditions following in behind .
temperatures climbing to around 20c ( 68f ) , so a mixed day on the whole .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: daventry fire caused by gas canister
text: a fire in a gas canister has caused businesses to be evacuated and roads to be closed in daventry this afternoon .
crews were called out to the royal oak industrial estate just after midday where they discovered an acetylene cylinder on fire .
a 200m cordon was put in place and nearby businesses were evacuated .
roads in and around the area remain closed .
the fire service says everything should be back to normal by 19:00 .
acetylene canisters can self heat and there 's a propensity for the cylinder to explode , so as a matter of routine we put a 200m cordon in place . ''
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: major roads in daventry closed following fire on industrial estate
text: fire crews are still at the scene of a fire at a business in daventry .
there is no access to royal oak way north and prospect way .
the a45 braunston way is also fully closed between daventry and braunston .
our reporter is at the scene
businesses evacuated and restrictions in place following fire near riley close in daventry @ twitterid

documents.title: fire on daventry estate
text: this afternoon we 've been made aware that emergency services are currently dealing with a fire in daventry at a business on the royal oak industrial estate .
a 200m cordon has been put in place off riley close , resulting in a number of road closures .
there is no access to royal oak way north and prospect way and the a45 braunston way is also partly closed .
the roads are expected to remain closed for several hours and motorists are advised to avoid the area , say police .
a number of businesses on the industrial estate have also been evacuated as a precaution .
we 'll bring you more when we have it .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fine for butcher who sold 'going off ' meat
text: a butcher in northampton has been fined £ 14,000 after pleading guilty to selling meat unfit for human consumption .
peter salmons , of terringham close , trades as the meating place in billing garden village .
he appeared before northampton magistrates facing five charges under the food safety act .

northamptonshire county council , whose trading standards team brought the prosecution , said tests showed some of salmons ' meat was `` going off '' and other meats were falsely labelled as being of british origin when they were n't .

`` these were very serious charges about issues that consumers would be unable to detect for themselves and i 'm delighted with the work of our trading standards officers in pursuing this case , '' said andre gonzalez de savage , county council deputy leader and cabinet member for public protection .
salmons was also ordered to pay costs of just over £ 2,000 and a victim surcharge of £ 120 .

author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : east midlands trains back to normal after train hit cows
text: trains are now able to run normally between bedford and leicester following disruption caused by cows on the line between # kettering
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cobblers v man u : northampton have got to 'grab the opportunity '
text: northampton town manager rob page says he 's really looking forward to `` pitting his wits '' against jose mourinho in tonight 's efl cup third-round tie .
in the previous round , the cobblers defeated west bromwich albion on penalties after the match ended in a 2-2 draw .
page says meeting man u at home is a fantastic opportunity for the players .
whatever team mourinho puts out will be tough opposition for the players and they 've just got to grab the opportunity .
no pressure on the lads , all the pressure is on them really . ''
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel : train disruption on east midlands trains until 13:00
text: there will be delays and disruption on the train line between bedford and leicester until 13:00 after a train hit two cows close to kettering this morning .
disruption between bedford and leicester until at least 13:00 # kettering
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: two cows hit by train
text: network rail has confirmed two cows were struck by a passenger train near glendon in kettering at about 10:00 this morning .
it means there are up to 20 minute delays on east midlands trains northbound between bedford and leicester .
a spokesman for the company said : `` we are working to repair damage to the train and clear the line in order to return services to normal as soon as possible . ''
# kettering lines are now open .
apologies for any disruption .
please check @ twitterid for service information .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: delays on east midlands line after train hits cattle
text: there are currently delays of up to 30 minutes on east midlands trains northbound between bedford and leicester due to a train striking a cow at kettering .
# emtupdate : trains can run between kettering & market harborough .
delays and cancellations expected .
please check journeys before travelling
thank you for keeping us informed about the cows on the track .
a well deserved 'pat ' on the back : )
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton sign tonga centre tuitavake
text: northampton sign tonga centre tuitavake

documents.title: cattle on line causing disruption to rail services
text: animals on the line are causing disruption to rail services between kettering and market harborough .
network rail says staff are on site and it has apologised for any delays .
trains will be disrupted between bedford and leicester until at least 12:00 .
# emtupdate : our trains are disrupted between kettering and market harborough because of cattle on the line .
more information to follow .
any update on the rapid response cow removal team ?
im stuck on the train directly behind
the rapid cow response are on site and will remooove this as quickly as possible .
any idea of the likely delay ?
there 's not eta at the moment .
the line is currently closed , we hope this will be resolved within the next hour .
any updates on this ?
the line has now reopened .
can you let us know where you 're travelling from and to ?
between kettering and market yarborough ,
next available train will be 1245 .
ok thanks
good afternoon alex .
oh no really ! !
yikes !
better travel by horse today then , eh .
# countrylife
you might get there a bit quicker by horse !
sounds like the passengers wo n't be a-moo-sed
send the mom along to moo-ve them !
how many cows are there ?
the train is 83 minutes late !
view from coach a , i think the rapid cow response team have their work cut out for them
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton saints sign tongan international player , nafi tuitavake
text: northampton saints have added another player to their squad .
tongan international centre nafi tuitavake joins from french side narbonne .
as well as playing for tonga , the 28-year-old has represented new zealand at under-20s level and sevens .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: saracens ' chris ashton banned for biting northampton prop
text: meanwhile , saracens and england winger chris ashton has been banned for 13 weeks after being found guilty of biting northampton prop alex waller .
after a six-hour hearing , a disciplinary panel found the 29-year-old bit waller on the arm in a ruck during saracens ' 27-12 premiership victory at allianz park on saturday .
the panel looked at two counts of biting but dismissed the second charge .
ashton , who denied both offences , can play again on 19 december .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cobblers v man u : match stats
text: tonight will be the fifth time the cobblers have met manchester united in any competition , but never in this one .
here 's a few stats from bbc sport to help you decide who may come out on top , but it 's a funny old game
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers v man u : team news
text: northampton town will be without winger paul anderson for tonight 's efl cup third-round tie against manchester united .
he is cup-tied having played for bradford city in an earlier round before joining the cobblers .
united midfielder michael carrick is set for his first outing of the season .
full-back luke shaw has a groin tear , striker anthony martial is a doubt with a head injury , while midfielder henrikh mkhitaryan has a thigh problem .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cobblers host man united in efl cup
text: northampton town host manchester united tonight in the third round of the efl cup .
it 'll be the fifth time the sides have met - the first time in the league cup - and only once have the cobblers avoided defeat .
the sides last met in 2004 ( years on from that 3-0 defeat united arrive with £ 89m man paul pogba at their disposal .
a record sixfields crowd will hold little expectation of an upset , but they will surely hope to avoid the fate of the 1970 cobblers team who were beaten 8-2 .
but , united have lost their last three games
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mainly dry , but chance of a shower this afternoon
text: early mist or fog will slowly clear through the morning to give a mainly dry day , with bright or sunny spells and light winds .
one or two showers may develop through the afternoon , but these will die out later .
maximum temperature 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of regular live updates of the latest news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be building up to the cobblers ' third round tie in the efl cup tonight when they 'll host manchester united at sixfields .
the premier league side are no doubt the favourites on paper , but as they 've lost their last three games - who knows ?
but first , we 'll see what the weather has in store for the county today , with a full weather forecast .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: regular updates throughout the day
text: that 's it for our regular updates of news , sport , travel and weather for today .
tomorrow , we 'll look ahead to what promises to be a memorable battle between the cobblers and manchester united .
we 'll also meet a local woman who 's rising to the occasion as one of the judges in the world bread awards .
any breaking news will appear hear overnight , but our regular service will be back again from 0800 .
have a good evening .

documents.title: local councillor 'not consulted ' on waste-to-energy plant
text: a labour county councillor in corby says she was not consulted about controversial plans for a `` gasification '' plant in her area .
the county council gave the go-ahead for the project earlier today , despite concerns about air quality and lorry movements .
julie brookfield said : `` the conservative county council felt this was contentious and difficult and did n't bother to ask me .
`` this is going to affect all the residents in the town . ''
we 've asked the tory party for a response .
campaigners against the plant have also taken to social media this afternoon .
one said : `` this is a raw deal for corby .
waste from across the e mids , an unsightly plant , 100+ more hgvs on the roads every day in return for 30 jobs . ''
developers say the plant will process nearly 200,000 tonnes of waste each year , which will be turned into power using a safe process .
they say it will deal both with the problem of getting rid of waste and of the shortage of sources of power .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: cobblers boss says no crisis at man utd
text: cobblers boss says no crisis at man utd

documents.title: weather : a dry and clear night ahead
text: any showers will die away to leave a mainly dry night with some areas of low cloud , mist and fog .
lows of 13c ( 55f ) and there 'll be very little wind .
tomorrow the mist , fog and low cloud will clear and then it should be mainly fine and dry with sunny spells and a few isolated showers .
top temperature 20c ( 68f ) and a light south-easterly breeze .
you can get your local forecast at anytime from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome home ellie !
text: britain 's paralympians have arrived back home to cheers from fans and family .
they returned from rio on a plane with a gold nose cone that touched down at heathrow .
northampton 's ellie robinson returned with two medals from her first paralym as the teenager came home with gold in the women 's s6 50m butterfly and bronze in the s6 100m freestyle .
`` it 's going to be weird going back to school a paralympic champion . ''
the 15 year-old , who attends northampton high school , also swam a personal best in rio .
welcome home ellie - we 're proud of you !
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a brief reminder of summer
text: sunshine came to most parts of the county today after a cloudy start .
here 's our selection of bbc weather watchers .
taken through the day .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: lib dem leader calls for second referendum on brexit deal
text: liberal democrat leader tim farron says his party 's pro-eu stance is striking a chord with voters in the east - even though most of the region voted leave in the eu referendum .
in an interview with bbc look east , he calls for another referendum once the brexit deal has been negotiated .

`` we completely respect the result of the june referendum , but what will happen now is a deal will be stitched up between people at westminster and brussels which will have a massive impact on jobs and prices in the east , '' he said .
`` how dare the government impose on the eastern region a deal which nobody voted for , so we are calling for the people to decide not just on the departure but the destination too . ''
liberal democrat membership in the east has increased by 1,700 since the eu referendum .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: police appeal for missing teenager
text: police are appealing for a 17-year-old girl to make contact with them .
merahawit temesgen was last seen in higham ferrers on 13 july and officers are appealing for her to let them know she is safe and well .
merahawit speaks little english and could have travelled to london or luton .
she is black , 5ft 2in , with brown eyes and of slim build .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: in the local papers
text: the northampton chronicle and echo is reporting a new suction cleaner has been brought in to brighten up the town 's streets .
it 's part of a £ 400,000 council investment programme .
meanwhile , the evening telegraph features a grieving father who 's trying to raise enough money for every school in corby to have its own defibrillator .
darren lafferty 's 10-year-old son collapsed and died at his school in corby two years ago .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: report highlights shortage of land for new houses
text: a report from the federation of master builders reveals that - for the second year in a row - there 's a lack of land for new house building .
two thirds of small and medium-sized builders say the lack of available and viable land is the biggest barrier to increasing the number of homes .
four out of 10 also say the construction skills crisis is a major problem .
paul campbell , an estate agent in daventry , says opposition to big developments is n't helping .
`` some people do n't like change on their doorstep and i do n't blame them , but people need to live in homes .
so we 've got this battle going on , '' he said .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: pictures released to raise awareness of rare skull condition
text: oliver cartwright , from northampton , was born with craniosynostosis - a rare problem that fused the bones of his skull .
now 18 , he 's training to be a chef and he 's won a pride of britain award for his bravery - after having more than 150 operations .
his mother julia has now published photos to raise awareness of the condition .
author: BBC Look East

documents.title: latest headlines for northamptonshire
text: if you 're just joining us , here 's what 's going on in northamptonshire :
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service declared animal rescue champions
text: a team from northamptonshire fire and rescue service has won a national competition to be declared animal rescue champions .
the team is based in wellingborough and they practice using a plastic horse and a special vehicle known as a `` unimog '' .
judges said the northamptonshire team demonstrated `` a high level of skill and professionalism '' in several rescue scenarios .
horses have a personal value , a bit like a pet , and we do n't want to see people upset thinking they 're going to lose them .
we 're going to provide the best care we can as a team . ''
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: judges toying with new inventions
text: toy inventors are getting a chance to pitch their latest ideas to manufacturers at an event in south northamptonshire .
the inventors ' workshop at whittlebury hall brings developers , retailers and investors together in an attempt to find the latest must-have toy .
i showed my own idea to inventor claire sciascia .
it 's a cake cannon , which fires tasty rewards at children who eat their vegetables .
claire was quite impressed
do n't think of stealing it now !
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: gasification plant in corby gets go-ahead
text: politicians have just approved the creation of a waste-to-energy plant in corby .
it 's due to be built on shelton road , on the willowbrook industrial estate .
once completed , it will generate around 16 megawatts of electricity using a process known as gasification .
some local people had raised concerns about air quality and the frequency of lorry movements .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: rio paralym celebrating 'team east 's ' medal haul
text: paralympic athletes from the east of england have secured 20 medals in rio as part of the squad 's impressive haul of 147 .

great britain closed the rio paralym with 64 gold medals , the most by a british team since 1988 - six of them were earned by athletes living or training in the east region.paralym surpassed their london 2012 medal tally of 120 on day nine of the games in rio and finished with 147 , second in the medal table behind china .
add your messages of congratulations to the bbc look east facebook page .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: community lottery could be launched in daventry
text: people in daventry are being asked whether they 'd like a community lottery to be introduced in the district .
it would offer cash prizes and boost the funding available for voluntary groups in the area .
officials say similar competitions in other parts of the country offer tickets at a cost of £ 1 , with cash prizes ranging from £ 25 to £ 25,000 .
entrants would be offered the opportunity to select a charity to benefit from a proportion of their ticket price .
a public consultation is being launched on the proposal .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: saracens ' player charged with biting saints ' prop
text: saracens ' wing chris ashton faces a disciplinary hearing in london tonight .
he 's charged by the rfu with biting northampton saints ' prop alex waller .
it 's alleged to have happened during last saturday 's premiership match at allianz park .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: all-clear for fishing in corby
text: officials in corby say a ban on fishing has now been lifted .
restrictions were imposed at the town 's boating lake because of fears that carp were showing signs of distress in the water .
the borough council says it 's still working with the environment agency to carry out tests , but anyone who wishes to fish in the lake can do so .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county team of the season 2016
text: county team of the season 2016

documents.title: ex-mp describes 'unnerving ' bank scam
text: figures show the number of scams targeting bank customers has risen by 50 % in the last year .
the banking industry is launching a campaign today called take five , encouraging people to stop and think if they receive a call or email asking for their bank details .
the former mp for northampton south , brian binley , was targeted by fraudsters some years ago .
he said : `` every step that the bank takes , the criminals are a very close step behind .
it 's very unnerving to have your identity stolen . ''
mr binley said there have been two attempts to steal from his bank account , and one of them was successful .
`` i had a credit card stolen and they simply walked into the bank , presented it over the counter , and walked out with £ 1,000 . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: stadium firm spent money on spurs
text: stadium firm spent money on spurs
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: northampton town stadium firm spent money on spurs
text: a company being investigated over the missing public money loaned to northampton town fc spent thousands of pounds on tickets to watch another football club .
accounts for 1st land limited indicate £ 36,000 was paid to tottenham hotspur for tickets and hospitality .
company director howard grossman and members of his family flew on a private vip jet with members of the spurs first team .

although most of 1st land 's income came from the council loan for the sixfields development , it did receive a fraction of its funding from another source - so there 's no direct evidence loan money was spent on spurs tickets .
a spokesman for howard grossman said he did not wish to comment .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: weather : murky start but brighter later
text: a dull morning to begin with but it will get brighter , with a top temperature of 17c ( 63f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to today 's live updates
text: between now and 18:00 we 'll have the latest revelations surrounding the failed sixfields development , and we 'll discover how a prominent local politician became the victim of an online scam .
we 'll also find out why toy inventors have descended on the south of the county .
plus all the latest weather and travel updates .
if you want to get in touch , drop us an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: regular updates throughout the day
text: that 's it for our regular updates for today .
thanks for joining us .
tomorrow we 'll bring you local reaction to a campaign to cut down on financial scams , along with the rest of the day 's news , sport , weather and travel .
any breaking stories will appear here overnight , and the regular updates will be back from 08:00 .
have a good evening .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy with outbreaks of rain
text: heavy showers will make their way down the east coast this evening , with outbreaks of showery rain spreading southwards .
it 'll turn murky in places overnight , with some mist and fog .
there 'll be light winds , and temperatures should stay in double figures .
tomorrow will be generally cloudy with some bright or sunny spells .
the last of the rain should clear , and it should then be largely dry - although there is the chance of some heavy and slow moving showers .
top temperature : 19 ( c ) ( 66f ) .
you can find more details on bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: crick team 'full of praise ' after 34-0 defeat
text: the secretary of the women 's football team that put 34 goals past the crick squad said their opponents were `` full of praise for us '' .
sheila lauder , of the corby town fc ladies team , said : `` in the second half , the crick goalkeeper pulled off some absolutely fantastic saves .
they are a very new , very inexperienced team and all credit to them - their spirit was excellent . ''
the victory leaves corby in fourth place in the county women 's league , while crick are bottom with a minus 80 goal difference - after just three games .
we 've contacted crick for comment .
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: england star and former kettering manager paul gascoigne fined for racist comment
text: in case you have n't spotted it in the national news today , former england footballer paul gascoigne has been fined £ 1,000 after he admitted making a racist comment in front of an audience of hundreds of people .

appearing before dudley magistrates ' court , the 49-year-old - who was briefly manager of kettering town in 2005 - admitted using `` threatening or abusive words or behaviour '' during his an evening with gazza show in wolverhampton last november .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 34-0 football victory included double hat-trick
text: corby town ladies fc have modestly described their 34-0 defeat of crick athletic colts ladies as `` emphatic '' .
the away game included a double hat-trick for nicole andrejczuk .
the win moves the team up to fourth place in the northamptonshire women 's football league .
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy and cool
text: today feels much more autumnal across northamptonshire , and there 's more cloud in places like ashby st ledgers , where weatherwatcherwill captured this rural scene .
it 'll stay overcast into this evening and there 'll be more spells of rain overnight , which could be heavy .
the top temperature 's expected to be 16c ( 61f ) , falling to 13c ( 55f ) .
get the full forecast on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'no need to negotiate ' on brexit - local mp
text: wellingborough mp peter bone , who 's part of a new `` leave means leave '' group , says the uk should n't negotiate the terms of its departure from the european union .
instead , he believes `` we should just tell the eu what we 're going to do '' .
`` leave means leave '' believes the uk should sever all ties with the eu and leave the single market altogether , even if the prime minister fails to secure a trade deal .

`` there are groups coming up from the other [ remain ] side to try to water down what we do , so i think it 's right that we have a pressure group which says 'come on , let 's do what the people said ' - especially the people in northamptonshire , '' said mr bone .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: former corby mp says tory mps could rebel over grammar schools
text: the former labour mp for corby , andy sawford , says the prime minister 's plans to allow more grammar schools to be created could split her party .
writing in the times educational supplement , mr sawford claims education professionals `` want to be left alone to get on with the job .
they feel that politicians should resist interfering '' .
he believes local opposition to grammars could `` push many more conservative mps into the rebel camp '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: in the local papers : apology over delays after train derailment waste plant could get green light
text: today the northampton chronicle and echo reports that london midland has apologised for delays and cancellations caused by a train derailment on the line near watford on friday .
services through northampton and long buckby are up and running this morning .
meanwhile , the evening telegraph says a controversial waste plant in corby is likely to get the go-ahead from county council planners tomorrow , despite `` widespread '' local objections .
the borough council says there has n't been enough information provided about air quality , odour and noise .

documents.title: 34-0 losing side praised for 'spirit and determination '
text: a women 's football team from corby is celebrating something of a cricket score in a local league match .
corby town ladies won 34-0 away to crick athletic colts ladies in sunday 's northamptonshire league one match .
on social media , the visiting team praised their hosts for their `` spirit and determination '' .
corby town ladies fc
corbytownladies
double figure win for the steelwomen today , credit to crick ladies for their spirit and determination ��
double figure win for the steelwomen today , credit to crick ladies for their spirit and determination
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: call for stiffer penalties for fly-tipping
text: the woman who 's in charge of waste management in the east of the county says courts should impose higher fines in cases of fly-tipping .
charlotte tomkins says over 400 incidents were investigated last year .
the worst example was the discovery of rotting meat in a layby .
`` the fine was somewhere in excess of £ 1,000 , '' said ms tomkins .
`` it 's not quite as much as the cost of collections , so we 'd like to see magistrates upping those fines if we get cases to court '' .
the council has increased the maximum on-the-spot penalty to £ 400 .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new wellingborough crematorium 'major step forward '
text: a celebrant based in wellingborough has described the town 's new crematorium as a `` major step forward '' for local people .
peter wyllie , who regularly conducts funerals at crematoria in northamptonshire , says `` the chapel is very lovely indeed bright , light and airy .
i think it seats 120 , compared to only 80 at northampton '' .
unlike the facilities in northampton and kettering , the new wellingborough building has the technology to allow funerals to be screened online for friends and relatives who ca n't attend in person .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new crematorium offers online funeral streaming
text: a new crematorium in wellingborough , which is set to stage its first funeral today , is offering the ability to stream funerals online .
independent celebrant peter wyllie said it 's good this service is now being offered in the county .
`` in a world where people have relatives spread around the globe , it will enable live webcast broadcasting of funerals which is very important , '' he said .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fines for fly-tipping increased in east northants
text: anyone caught fly-tipping in the east of the county could now face a fine of £ 400 .
politicians have agreed to implement new government regulations that allow local authorities to increase on-the-spot penalties for dumping rubbish .
more than 40 fixed-penalty notices have been issued in the district since 2013 and there have been 11 prosecutions .
officials say they 've seen some bizarre examples of fly-tipping , including rotting meat by the roadside .
a business in the area decided that their off meat was just going to be dumped in a layby , so you can imagine what that was like in the summer for local residents . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fly-tipping costs northants £ 1m a year
text: new figures show fly-tipping costs northamptonshire taxpayers £ 1m a year .
last year there were nearly 15,000 incidents reported in the county , according to the environmental services association ( esa ) .
an analysis shows all councils in northamptonshire are affected , but easily the largest number of incidents - about 11,000 - happen in northampton .

many tipping incidents are said to come from members of the public , but the esa says it 's concerned businesses do n't appreciate they have a legal duty of care to know how their waste is being disposed of , and is calling for more education on the subject .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: lewis hamilton determined to 'reunite ' and regather ' following singapore result
text: lewis hamilton said he would regroup after a dispiriting singapore grand prix , as he attempts to get his world title challenge back on track for brackley-based mercedes .
the stevenage driver 's team-mate nico rosberg reclaimed the lead by eight points with victory at marina bay , as hamilton came third .
`` it does n't always go well and this has been a difficult weekend for me and my side of the garage , '' hamilton said .
`` but we will reunite and regather and understand what went wrong and try to rectify it for the next race . ''
it was rosberg 's third victory in succession and eighth of the year , compared with six for hamilton .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer at Monza

documents.title: ellie robinson adds bronze to paralympic collection
text: meanwhile , northampton 's 15-year-old swimmer ellie robinson added a second paralympic medal to her collection at the weekend .
she took bronze in the s6 100m freestyle after winning gold in the s6 butterfly .
last night 's closing ceremony of the paralym included a tribute to iranian cyclist bahman golbarnezhad , who died in an event on saturday .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cobblers ' unbeaten run ends at the feet of chesterfield
text: northampton town 's 31-game unbeaten run in league matches came to an end at the weekend when a conor wilkinson double helped chesterfield to a 3-1 victory at the proact stadium .
the on-loan bolton striker scored in each half and although paul anderson pulled a goal back , dion donohue sealed chesterfield 's first win in five games .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: today 's weather : mostly cloudy
text: it 'll be a more settled start to the new working week with none of last week 's extremes of either heat or rain .
the day will generally be cloudy with patchy rain , but there could also be some bright or sunny intervals .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to monday 's northamptonshire live
text: thanks for joining us for another week of live news , sport , weather and travel updates for northamptonshire .
you can get in touch with us at any time today either via email , facebook or twitter .
today 's weather forecast is coming up next
